other_tests.findings: Lower Thorax: No pleural effusion. Liver: Diffuse dropout of liver signal compatible with hepatic steatosis (fat fraction 2%). Millimetric mildly T2 hyperintense lesion in segment 7 likely a hemangioma. Biliary: Normal caliber intra and extrahepatic bile ducts. Small gallstone in the gallbladder with small pericholecystic fluid. Pancreas: Homogeneous signal, pancreatic duct not dilated. Spleen: Normal size. Right adrenal gland unremarkable; 0.6 cm nodular thickening of left adrenal gland likely benign. Left kidney: Millimetric T2 hyperintense lesion compatible with a renal cyst, no hydronephrosis. Gastrointestinal tract: Stomach unremarkable; small and large bowel loops normal caliber. No lymphadenopathy. Abdominal aorta normal caliber. No suspicious bone or soft tissue lesion identified.
